name: technical-work-plan-for-revegetation-continuation-maintenance-and-monitoring-projects-usfw-37d0e
notes: The U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service at Rocky Mountain Arsenal is charged with managing wildlife and wildlife habitat, both during and following cleanup of contaminants. This management includes mitigation for damage to existing wildlife habitats due to cleanup activities. Most damages are mitigated under the Terrestrial Restoration Program, an umbrella program for mitigation and restoration of grasslands that is sanctioned by the Remediation Venture Office.Since the beginning of FY 1998, most new habitat restoration projects mitigate the impact of the remediation projects outlined in the Record of Decision and their associated borrow sites. Most pre1997 mitigation efforts centered around damages related to past cleanup activities, particularly Interim Response Actions. Almost all mitigation projects require at least 23 years of initial work, 13 additional years of maintenance, and numerous years of monitoring. This mitigation plan 5104 identifies 28 of those projects needing work beyond the first years efforts. Plan 5104 proposes provide maintenance on 15 projects, and monitor 17 of them.  The objective of this project is to promote i.e., continue or maintain and monitor habitat restoration projects that partially mitigate impacts from a variety of cleanup activities on the Arsenal. Specific objectives for specific projects are described within the original plans for the individual projects.
